title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal during Team USA's win over Denmark in the Olympics.
Swayman attributed the goal to losing sight of the puck and later laughed off the incident.
The U.S. team won despite Swayman's performance, with 18 saves and possible future starts contested by other goalies.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum nears return from Achilles injury, absent from All-Star weekend for the first time in six years.
NBA stars Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony anticipate Tatum's return will significantly boost the Celtics' playoff prospects.
Tatum has participated in recent practice sessions, including with the Maine Celtics, suggesting progress in his recovery.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space to address offseason needs, including retaining key free agents like K’Lavon Chaisson.
Potential target WR Alec Pierce led the NFL in yards per reception and surpassed 1,000 receiving yards with the Colts in 2025.
Ravens TE Isaiah Likely, a solid run blocker and pass catcher, is a potential free agent addition with upside for the Patriots.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN is MLB's new streaming partner with MLB.TV available as an add-on for ESPN Unlimited subscribers.
MLB.TV costs $134.99 for ESPN Unlimited subscribers and $149.99 for non-subscribers, including a month of ESPN Unlimited.
Existing MLB.TV subscribers automatically renew via their current accounts, with optional ESPN Unlimited free trial access.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum practiced with the Maine Celtics, sparking speculation of his possible return this season.
Celtics' Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement about Tatum looking like himself during the G League practice.
Brad Stevens confirms Tatum will only return when fully ready; no timetable for his comeback is set yet.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the U.S. in WalletHub's 2026 analysis.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree, with nearly 22% having a graduate degree.
Vermont and Maryland ranked second and third, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia were last.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction — and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card, owned by Morton Bernstein's family, is up for auction by Goldin Auctions.
Bernstein's family has kept the card for 116 years; it's currently valued at $4.758 million with buyer's premium.
The card is connected to Boston through the Bernstein family's historic business ties to Taunton, Massachusetts.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Bruins goalie Jeremy Swayman to start for Team USA against Denmark in the 2026 Olympics, his first Olympic game.
Swayman, 27, has been a key player for Team USA and excelled in the 2025 IIHF World Championship.
Connor Hellebuyck started the previous Olympic game for Team USA and will back up Swayman against Denmark.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A dead 3-year-old North Atlantic right whale was discovered on a barrier island off Virginia, identified by the New England Aquarium.
This is the second right whale death in two weeks, with the species critically endangered and only about 380 remaining.
NOAA Fisheries and partners will conduct a necropsy; entanglements and vessel strikes are main threats to the species.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Seven pediatric flu deaths reported in Massachusetts this season, according to the Massachusetts Department of Public Health.
In recent months, 260 flu-related deaths have occurred in Massachusetts, including 253 adults.
Flu activity has strained hospitals; officials urge vaccinations for vulnerable groups like young children and older adults.
